events.name: Couchbase Meetup #1 - New features in Couchbase 4.5 Server
events.description: New features in Couchbase 4.5: Server to Build Scalable Application  The talk will explore the new features coming in Couchbase Server 4.5. These include memory-optimized global indexes, sub-document API, auto-schema discovery, and security enhancements. The talk is also about Multi-Dimensional Scaling, symmetric scaling to distribute the workload equally between nodes that allows each of the workloads to scale independently.  Latest innovations in index, query, and data access for blazing performance, Query workbench feature that makes it easy to explore and understand the shape and form of your data, enhanced security including role-based access control.  Speaker: Clarence J M Tauro, Senior Instructor, Couchbase Learning Services
events.location: Ashnik Pte Ltd, Cecil Street, #11-11 Tong Eng Building, Singapore 069533, Singapore

events.name: ProductTank: Product and Data
events.description:
THEME: PRODUCT x DATA Great product managers are capable of striking a good balance between qualitative and quantitative research.  During this ProductTank meetup, we will explore two major topics within this theme: • Designing product data infrastructure and services • Agile user research  


SPEAKERS AND TALKS #1 Pavel Kudinov, Lead Data Engineer; RedMart—Stop Deleting the Data: Designing services that won't forget anything. Pavel has been creating data products for retail, logistics and e-commerce for over 10 years. He loves to help businesses deliver value to users and stakeholders by developing forecasting and demand planning systems, churn prediction, e-commerce personalization engines.  


#2 Rudi Lim, UX Lead; Grab—Actionable insights from running Agile User Research Rudi is a user experience researcher with well over a decade of industry experience. Currently, he's leading a regional user research team at Grab (formerly GrabTaxi). An avid educator, Rudi has been giving UX workshops and training to private clients since 2006.  AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:05 - 19:35 - First speaker: talk and Q&A (20 min + 10 min) 19:35 - 19:50 - Break! 19:50 - 20:20 - Second speaker: talk and Q&A (20 min + 10 min) 20:20 - 21:00 - Networking. 21:00 - Event ends. 


Notes: • Exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm. • Registration closes at 00:00 on Wednesday, June 8. • Remember to bring your identity cards for smooth check-in with the building security. :)

events.name: Functional Programming in Scala Coursera Study Group Week 3
events.description: Same as last time but covering week 3. As usual everyone welcome. Looking forward to seeing everyone there.
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: The future of Elixir
events.description:
We're back again with our 4th meetup! We're meeting on 9th of June at 7PM in ThoughtWorks office. We're still looking for speakers. If you've done anything interesting using Elixir or Erlang, or if there's some topic you'd like to discuss, let us know! Agenda: 7.00pm Doors open 7.20pm Christian Trabold will talk about his experience at ElixirConf.EU and new features that will appear in Elixir 1.3 7.50pm free slot - suggest some topic to present or discuss! 8.30pm wrap up 


Venue and snacks are provided by Thoughtworks
